_header: I wail I weep I sob I sigh full sore
Title(s): On the Death of the Earl of Northumberland
Subjects: occasional verse; Percy, Henry, earl of Northumberland
_description: John Skelton, On the Death of the Earl of Northumberland (1489) — thirty-one stanzas rhyme royal

BLRoy18Dii.First Lines: I wayle I wepe I sobbe I sigh ful soreThe dedely fate the dolefulle destenny…
BLRoy18Dii.Last Lines: …The father the son and the holy gosteIn trinitate one god of myghte moste
BLRoy18Dii.Note: Opens with Latin incipit “Ad dominum Properato meum, mea pagina. Percy. Qui Northumbrorum iura paterna gerit…” (f. 165ra)
BLRoy18Dii.Attributed Author: Poeta Skelton Laureatus Libellum suum metrice Allquitur (f. 165); Skelton laureat vpon the dolorus dethe and muche lamentable chaunce of the mooste honorable Erle of Northumberlande (f. 165ra)
BLRoy18Dii.Attributed Title: Poeta Skelton Laureatus Libellum suum metrice Allquitur (f. 165); Skelton laureat vpon the dolorus dethe and muche lamentable chaunce of the mooste honorable Erle of Northumberlande (f. 165ra)
